Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First lets summarize the steps in order 1 The patient begins with Arrival then Registration then Intake Assessment So these three are in sequence

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After IA the patient undergoes Triage Interview and then Triage Classification in sequence TI TC

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Based on triage classification there is an exclusive decision on the type of initial diagnostic tests If the patient is suspected of a cardiovascular issue they perform a Comprehensive ECG Otherwise Full Blood Panel Only one of these tests will be performed So we have an XOR between CE and FBP

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: After the initial diagnostic test the results must be evaluated If the results are abnormal a loop commences The patient must be reviewed by a Specialist Consultation After consultation an exclusive treatment choice is made Administer a Targeted Medication or Provide a Specialized Physical Therapy session Following the treatment the patient must undergo a ReDiagnostic Test step The RDT itself is an exclusive choice Either a Followup ECG or A Followup Blood Analysis This loop repeats after the re diagnostic test if the results are still abnormal the patient returns to the Specialist Consultation until the results are deemed normal

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So the loop body should be A SC then an XOR between TM and SPT then an XOR between FCE and FBA In the loop operator A is executed then either you exit the loop or you execute B and then A again So we need to decide what is A and what is B So we can set B tau the loop would be A then either exit or tau and then A again

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: the loop is entered only if results are abnormal If results are normal we skip the loop So the structure is after the initial test we have a XOR between the loop and tau AfterTestChoice X Loop tau That would mean either we do the loop which executes A at least once or we do nothing tau

Name: Validation - PE
Text: if we choose the loop branch we do at least one LoopBody That means that if results are abnormal we do at least one iteration That is correct If results are normal we choose the tau branch and skip the loop entirely So that matches

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: After the loop or skip we have two activities in true concurrency Advanced Imaging and Nutritional Counseling Both activities should be completed but their order and concurrency are not fixed they can be done in parallel So + AI NC Once the advanced imaging and nutritional counseling are finished the patient goes through a final sequence Followup Appointment Scheduling then Detailed Discharge Instructions Before the patient can leave a concurrency block handles Billing Insurance Claims Processing Medical Records Finalization These three activities occur in true concurrency

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The overall process is a sequence of blocks We sequence them with operators The entire tree is a long sequence from A to the end with nested operators for XOR loop parallel inside

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: However there is another interpretation maybe the loop should be SC then choice between TM and SPT then either exit or do the re diagnostic test and repeat That would not match because the re diagnostic test is part of the loop body and should be done each iteration in the first iteration after treatment we do the re diagnostic test So our model is correct

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Lets verify the order A then RG then IA then TI then TC then initial test then loop or skip then AI and NC parallel then FAS then DDI then final parallel block So the order is correct
